utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I brought my son here. I'm a little bit worried about him because like yesterday he had he had this temperature of like 38.5 um so he's been feeling a little bit hot and he's not swallowing his food, like we've been feeding him some mashed up food but he's not swallowing it. He's just kind of throwing throwing it back out there. Um he's drooling now uh and he sounds kind of muffled um and he's been very short of breath.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: That doesn't sound good. Um uh yeah, I'm I'm currently looking at him and he doesn't uh look great. While the uh while the doctor's um taking his vitals and examining the baby, I'll just ask you a couple of questions.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So you said that all of this started about a day ago. How was he doing before that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: He was fine before that, he had like a an infection, like some sort of viral infection recently, like about a week back, he had like a runny nose and a cough, but that went away.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um OK, so he had these symptoms about a week ago. Did he see any, did you take him to the hospital or to a clinic?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I took him to our family doctor um and they just suggested some supportive treatments um which we've been doing at home like we try to keep him well hydrated, and we've been keeping an eye on his like um diapers and things like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, has he been um has he been, how many diapers is he um, are you changing a day?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Usually like about 5, 6, but yesterday it was like 2.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um and uh has he been uh irritable or agitated?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh he has been very irritable and fussy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Has he been sleeping OK?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I um no you know what last night he didn't sleep well at all. He was crying the whole night.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um and uh in terms of uh, so how much has he has he had to eat or drink in the past uh day or two?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh he's had about like maybe a bottle of his milk, like of that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: That's it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, he's not taking. He's not he's not taking anything else like he's been so fussy and so like he's unwilling to try anything.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um and, OK. Do you feel like he's been drowsy uh and um lethargic?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um yeah, I feel like he's been a little bit lethargic. Like today, he's more lethargic. All of yesterday, he was very fussy and irritable, but today seems like, he's very slow.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and just a couple of questions about um his past medical history. Does he have any uh medical conditions uh that he was diagnosed with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, he's been healthy otherwise.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How was your pregnancy with him?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Normal, yeah no complications there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Did did you have GBS or gestational diabetes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Did you have any viral infections during that time, during pregnancy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Was he born via Caesarean section or uh C-section or a vaginal birth?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh vaginal.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any complications during birth?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Was he um kept in the hospital for a couple days in the NICU after he was born?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Did he develop jaundice?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and and he's been OK for the past two years? Any concerns about his growth, his height and weight, and his head circumference? Has your family doctor uh said anything about that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, he's been pretty good. Um he's been growing and gaining weight OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any um developmental issues?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright, and any medical conditions that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, just like some heart issues.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um OK, and uh does he, I forgot to ask, has he had any hospitalizations in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any surgeries?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No surgeries.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uh has he been on any medications? Any antibiotics recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Has um has he been vaccinated? Uh has his vaccinations, immunizations up to date?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, they're all up to date so far.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright, that's that's good. Um OK, and does he have any allergies that you're aware of?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Pardon me?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh, uh no allergies.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK alright um well it looks like um I, it's great that you brought him into the emergency room. Um if he hasn't been eating, drinking well, hasn't slept well, has been fussy, and and has been lethargic and tired, uh and is having difficulty swallowing food, um that's definitely very um serious. Uh we'll have a look inside his mouth and see what's going on. It could be that he has an infection or an inflammation of some sort. Um given his fever, he probably has an infection, um and uh we'll likely start him on antibiotics and put in an IV drip just to get in get some fluids inside him, just to get him hydrated, uh and monitor him very closely. We'll also check his vitals and um we'll do uh, yeah, we'll go from there. Do you have any questions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
